g.text: In conclusion, a series of double perovskites, LaSr
adopt a monoclinic structure. In LaSrNiReO
0.0), an unusual divergence between the ZFC and FC curves
is identified with the magnetic state that arises from Re
ions sitting in a geometrically frustrated fcc sublattice
in DP host. At low temperature (~27 K), the system undergoes another magnetic transition, where weak ferro-
magnetism predicted by Goodenough-Kanamori rule could be identified. As lattice parameter decreases with Ca
doping, the reduced Ni-O-Re bond angle introduces nonzero overlap integral between Ni
which favors a ferrimagnetic alignment between Ni and Re sublattices along the
diffraction measurement conducted at room temperature and low temperature (2 K) revealed that the
sample possesses a disordered/short-range magnetic state at low temperature, while for Ca sample, the Ni and Re
sublattices aligned ferrimagnetically to give a long range magnetic order evidenced from the magnetic Bragg peak
corresponding to the double perovskite superlattice peak.
0.0, 0.5, 1.0) were synthesized by solid state synthesis route.
and Re metal were used as the starting materials. The synthesis
was done in two steps. In the first step, La
was made by heating a mixture of stoichiometric La
NiO at 1250 °C in an inert atmosphere for 48 hours with several intermediate grinding. SrO and CaO were used
after heating them at 1250 °C and 1000 °C for 12 hours in an inert atmosphere. Next, stoichiometric amount of
and Re metal were mixed inside a glovebox and the resultant mixture was sealed
inside a quartz tube, which was then annealed at 1200 °C for the final product.
The phase purity of the three samples (
0.0, 0.5, 1.0) were checked by x-ray diffraction (XRD) Bruker
1.54059 Å) as well as at MCX beamline of the Elettra
Synchrotron Centre, Italy using wavelength of 0.751 Å. The XRD data were analyzed via Rietveld refinement
program. La, Ca, Sr, Ni, Re quantitative analysis were performed in Inductively Coupled
Plasma Optical Emission Spectroscopy (ICP-OES) (Perkin-Elmer USA, Optima 2100 DV) instrument following
. magnetic measurements were carried out in a Quantum Design SQUID
magnetometer. Resistivity measurements were performed in a home made four probe setup. Soft x-ray absorption
spectroscopy (XAS) was performed at I1011 beamlines of the Swedish synchrotron facility MAX-lab, Lund. All
the XAS spectra were measured by recording the total electron yield. Neutron powder diffraction (NPD) meas-
urements were performed using the HRPT
diffractometer at the Paul Scherrer Institut, SINQ (Switzerland).
The neutron wavelength was set to
structure refinements were performed using the FullProf suite
1. Anderson, M. T., Greenwood, K. B., Taylor, G. A. & Poeppelmeier, K. R. B-cation arrangements in double perovskites.
2. Knapp, M. C. & Woodward, P. M. A-Site Cation Ordering in AA
3. Vasala, S. & Karppinen, M. A B
4. Serrate, D., De. Teresa, J. M. & Ibarra, M. R. Double perovskites with ferromagnetism above room temperature.
5. Chen, G., Pereira, R. & Balents, L. Exotic phases induced by strong spin-orbit coupling in ordered double perovskites.
6. Chen, G. & Balents, L. Spin-orbit coupling in d
. Structure and magnetic properties of the S
1 geometrically frustrated double perovskites La LiReO
8. Vries, M. A., de., Mclaughlin, A. C. & Bos, J. W. G. Valence Bond Glass on an fcc Lattice in the Double Perovskite Ba
. Magnetic properties of the geometrically frustrated S
B-site ordered double perovskite structure: Evidence for a collective spin-singlet ground state.
10. Wiebe, C. R., Greedan, J. E., Luke, G. M. & Gardner, J. S. Spin-glass behavior in the S
. Frustration-driven spin freezing in the S
. Ferromagnetism in the Mott Insulator Ba
13. Xiang, H. J. & Whangbo, M. H. Cooperative effect of electron correlation and spin-orbit coupling on the electronic and magnetic
14. Yamamura, K., Wakeshima, M. & Hinatsu, Y. Structural phase transition and magnetic properties of double perovskites Ba
. Long range magnetic order in the 5d
16. Shannon, R. D. Revised effective ionic radii and systematic studies of interatomic distances in halides and chalcogenides.
17. Brese, N. E. & ÓKeeffe, M. Bond-valence parameters for solids. Acta Crystallogr.
Pr, Nd): Nickel valence and the metal-insulator transition investigated by x-ray
19. Mott, N. F. Conduction in non-crystalline materials.
20. Alamelu, T., Varadaraju, U. V., Venkatesan, M., Douvalis, A. P. & Coey, J. M. D. Structural and magnetic properties of (Sr Ca)FeReO.
. Synthesis, structure, and magnetic properties of novel B-site ordered double perovskites, SrLaMReO
22. Bertaut, E. F., Corliss, L., Forrat, F., Aleonard, R. & Pauthenet, R. Etude de niobates et tantalates de metaux de transition bivalents.
